intro: Codonopsis rotundifolia, commonly known as the roundleaf bellflower, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of China. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its tubular, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to violet. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and features hairy stems and heart-shaped leaves. Its root system is fibrous and often used in traditional Chinese medicine for its purported health benefits. The plant thrives in well-drained soils and prefers partial shade to full sun.
